result.execSummary:
The defendant Jodi L Sinclair was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must report to the Rice Lake Probation office by 3:00 PM on Tuesday, February 3, 2015.

miscConds.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must undergo a mental health evaluation and follow-up with recommended treatment.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Court grants Huber.
Consecutive to: Count 1.
Concurrent with: Count 1 together with conditions.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jodi L Sinclair

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jodi L Sinclair in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files Amended Information and Victim Impact Statement. Court files Amended Information. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1 - Misdemeanor Theft and Count 2 - Misdemeanor Criminal Damage to Property. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. Court accepts Defendant's pleas as knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given. Victims make statement. State makes argument. Defense makes argument. Defendant makes statement.

Court relates and orders:

Count 1: 60 days jail with Huber if revoked - STAYED
2 yrs Probation - IMPOSED
Must report by 3:00 p.m. on Tuesday, February 3, 2015 to the Rice Lake Probation office.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment. 
Undergo mental health evaluation and follow-up with recommended treatment.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Court costs including DNA surcharge.
1 days jail credit if revoked.

Count 2: 60 days jail consecutive to Count 1 - with Huber if revoked - STAYED
2 yrs Probation - concurrent with all the same conditions as Count 1 - IMPOSED
Court costs + DNA surcharge.

Defendant Jodi L Sinclair in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense recites agreement reached. State to file Amended Information and C-31 at or prior to plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jodi L Sinclair in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Reset.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jodi L Sinclair in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:46 Deputy Jeffrey Wolfe called and sworn - Direct by State 11:51 Cross exam by Attorney Harrington 11:51 Court questions witness 11:52 Court finds probable cause and binds over - Information filed - Reading waived - Not guilty plea entered - Court instructs ADA Berg to check on fingerprint card - Bond continued.
  Plea hearing scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
9/4/14 Letter from Clerk of Court Office to Jodi Sinclair regarding repayment of attorney fees
8/29/14 Letter to Defendant from Judicial Assistant informing Defendant to sign wage assignment within 1 week
